{{DISPLAYTITLE:<samp>textures-atlas</samp>}}
{{for|a comprehensive history of block texture changes|Java Edition history of textures}}
{{exclusive|java}}
[[File:19w45a textures-atlas.png|thumb|<samp>textures-atlas</samp> in [[Java Edition 19w46b]], the last version to actually use this file.]]

'''<samp>textures-atlas</samp>''' was a [[texture atlas]] used to store all [[block]] and [[item]] textures, and was later used for many other types of textures.

== Format ==
<samp>textures-atlas</samp>, upon first introduction, was a fixed-width 512&times;512-pixel file that was split into different 16&times;16-pixel squares for most blocks and items, although flowing liquids used 32&times;32. The size would later expand to 2048&times;1024 in its final versions of use.

While initially only used for blocks, fluids, items, the block breaking animation, and item frames, it would eventually see use for many other objects of the game:
* [[Banner]]s
* [[Shield]]s
* [[Banner pattern]]s, both those on banners and on shields
* [[Sign]]s
* [[Chest]]s
* [[Shulker box]]es
* [[Bed]]s
* [[Bell]]s
* [[Conduit]]s
* The book on top of [[enchanting table]]s

The [[missing texture]] also remained present in each version.

== Viewing ==
As <samp>textures-atlas</samp> is only generated for internal usage by the game, it is often never visible in its entirety. However, from its introduction in 14w25a up until 1.8, copies of it would be produced in the [[.minecraft]] folder for debug purposes; this was removed in the first pre-release for 1.8.1.

As the UV mapping for block and item models is unbounded, custom models can be used to view the atlas in-game in full, though high-quality copies will not be obtainable through this method.

From 19w41a, resource packs can also display the atlas using shader tricks. This can be used to view several different atlases before changes in 21w10a make this impossible. An example resource pack can be found [https://discord.com/channels/154777837382008833/157097006500806656/634263809342570506 here] in the Minecraft Commands discord server alongside instructions.

== History ==
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=14w25a|Added <samp>textures-atlas</samp>, deprecating the existing <samp>[[blocks-atlas]]</samp> and <samp>[[items-atlas]]</samp>.
|The game now outputs copies of the atlas, under the name <samp>textures_0.png</samp>, <samp>textures_1.png</samp>, <samp>textures_2.png</samp>, <samp>textures_3.png</samp> and <samp>textures_4.png</samp>, to the [[.minecraft]] folder.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8.1|dev=pre1|<samp>textures_[0-4].png</samp> are no longer produced in the .minecraft folder.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.9|dev=15w41a|<samp>textures-atlas</samp> has now expanded from 512&times;512 to 1024&times;512 pixels.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.15|dev=19w38a|<samp>textures-atlas</samp> has now expanded from 1024&times;512 to 2048&times;1024 pixels.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=Pre-release 1
|<samp>textures-atlas</samp> is no longer generated by the game, instead having been split into several smaller atlases:
* Blocks and items into <samp>[[blocks.png-atlas]]</samp>
* Banner patterns into <samp>[[banner_patterns.png-atlas]]</samp>
* Shield patterns into <samp>[[shield_patterns.png-atlas]]</samp>
* Shulker boxes into <samp>[[shulker_boxes.png-atlas]]</samp>
* Beds into <samp>[[beds.png-atlas]]</samp>
* Chests into <samp>[[chest.png-atlas]]</samp>
* Signs into <samp>[[signs.png-atlas]]</samp>}}
}}

==== Mipmapped versions ====
Up to four mipmapped versions of each atlas would also be generated by the game, depending on the current values in Video Settings. The textures would be shrunk to 8&times;8, 4&times;4, 2&times;2 and 1&times;1, and would render instead of the normal textures at far distances or sharp angles of incidence.
